content: "{\"object\":\"value\",\"document\":{\"object\":\"document\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"EPAM Projects\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The following project types are defined in EPAM:\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Production Project Type:\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" Includes any project executed for an external Customer (i.e. Customer is not a member of EPAM). Shall be used for the majority of projects we have. \\rAccording to EPAM Management Tools the Production Project Types fall into the following project categories:\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"unordered-list\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Production – Delivery (SW Development, Testing, Maintenance and Support, SAP Consultancy): includes Requirements development, Architecture and design development, Coding, Quality Control (Functional testing, Performance testing, Acceptance testing, Peer Review, etc.), Product deployment (or part of these activities), Maintenance and Support and uses EPAM processes according to EPAM QMS requirements;\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Production – Administration: where EPAM manages non-billable activities related to Customer;\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Production – Presales: any kind of Presales activity, including real Proof of Concept creation, Feasibility Study, or just holding sales department related activities.\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"list-item-child\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Internal Project Type:\",\"marks\":[{\"object\":\"mark\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-bold\",\"data\":{}}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\" includes any Project Category where Customer is EPAM, e.g. Internal – Administration (Project Administration not directly related to project execution); Internal - BizDev (any kind of Pre-sales activity, including real Proof of Concept creation, Feasibility Study, or just holding sales department related activities), etc.\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]}]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"To learn more about project types see \",\"marks\":[]},{\"object\":\"inline\",\"type\":\"link\",\"data\":{\"url\":\"https://epam.sharepoint.com/sites/policy/SitePages/Policy/Guidelines/Guideline Project Management.aspx\"},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Project Management Guideline\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\".\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"uui-richTextEditor-header-3\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Project Artifacts\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"Project artifacts include: Project Management Plan, Status Reports, Case Study, Project Schedule, Product Architecture and Design documents, Release Notes, Requirements Specifications, Requirement Management Plan, Vision, Test Plan, Test Cases, Test Result Report, Source Code,  Project Risk Management Plan, Configuration and Change Management Plan, etc.\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"The main project management document is Project Management Plan. It describes project goals, project structure, responsibilities, life cycle, used methodologies. Project Plan can contain or refer to other plans. Basically, this document is a starting point for studying for anyone who joins the project. Note: a Project Management Plan is not mandatory for all projects.\\r\",\"marks\":[]}]},{\"object\":\"block\",\"type\":\"paragraph\",\"data\":{},\"nodes\":[{\"object\":\"text\",\"text\":\"A set of mandatory project artifacts is based on Project Type, Engagement Model and Project size.
